metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3733 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in urllib's AbstractBasicAuthHandler class. An attacker who controls a malicious HTTP server that an HTTP client (such as web browser) connects to, could trigger a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDOS) during an authentication request with a specially crafted payload that is sent by the server to the client. The greatest threat that this flaw poses is to application availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> code affected in hirsute and devel is already patched, so both releases in python3.9 are not affected.

criterions.comment: python3.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1').
